member.name: MIDIOUTCAPS
member.summary: The MIDIOUTCAPS structure describes the capabilities of a MIDI output device.

member.name: MIDIOUTCAPS.wMid
member.summary: Manufacturer identifier of the device driver for the MIDI output device. Manufacturer identifiers are defined in Manufacturer and Product Identifiers.

member.name: MIDIOUTCAPS.wPid
member.summary: Product identifier of the MIDI output device. Product identifiers are defined in Manufacturer and Product Identifiers.

member.name: MIDIOUTCAPS.vDriverVersion
member.summary: Version number of the device driver for the MIDI output device. The high-order byte is the major version number, and the low-order byte is the minor version number.

member.name: MIDIOUTCAPS.szPname
member.summary: Product name in a null-terminated string.

summary.para: Type of the MIDI output device. This value can be one of the following:

member.name: MIDIOUTCAPS.wVoices
member.summary: Number of voices supported by an internal synthesizer device. If the device is a port, this member is not meaningful and is set to 0.

member.name: MIDIOUTCAPS.wNotes
member.summary: Maximum number of simultaneous notes that can be played by an internal synthesizer device. If the device is a port, this member is not meaningful and is set to 0.

member.name: MIDIOUTCAPS.wChannelMask
member.summary: Channels that an internal synthesizer device responds to, where the least significant bit refers to channel 0 and the most significant bit to channel 15. Port devices that transmit on all channels set this member to 0xFFFF.

summary.para: Optional functionality supported by the device. It can be one or more of the following:

listheader.description: Supports separate left and right volume control.
Provides direct support for the midiStreamOut function.

summary.para: If a device supports volume changes, the MIDICAPS_VOLUME flag will be set for the dwSupport member. If a device supports separate volume changes on the left and right channels, both the MIDICAPS_VOLUME and the MIDICAPS_LRVOLUME flags will be set for this member.
